userInfo.name: Harsh Verma
userInfo.about: I am a product designer specializing in furniture design for the premium residential and commercial sector.
userInfo.thought: Open to collaborate with architects and interior designers on furniture design for residential and commercial projects.

bio.question: This year I'm trying to...
bio.caption: Work on diverse projects that is challenging and enhances my creativity and skills

bio.question: What would your TED Talk be about?
bio.caption: Design can transform spaces and objects into functional and beautiful solutions that enhance people's lives and well-being.

bio.question: A cause I really care about..
bio.caption: Promoting design literacy and awareness among people and empowering them to use design as a tool for positive change and innovation.

education.degree: Bachelor of Business Administration and Bachelor of Legislative Law
education.description: Studying BBA and BLL was a rewarding and challenging experience for me. I learned how to apply business principles and legal frameworks to real-world problems. I also gained valuable skills in communication, teamwork, research, and analysis. I enjoyed interacting with my professors and peers, who inspired me to pursue my goals.

education.degree: Bachelor of Design, Furniture and interior design
education.description: Studying design, furniture and interior design was a creative and fulfilling experience for me. I learned how to design functional and aesthetic spaces and objects that reflect the needs and preferences of the clients. I also developed skills in drawing, modeling, prototyping, and presenting my ideas. I appreciated the feedback and guidance from my professors and peers, who helped me improve my craft.

experience.description: Self motivated individual who is also versatile, logically driven and hard working. Likes to think things through and thus looks for challenges and opportunities to experiment.
Working as a furniture designer was a rewarding and enjoyable experience for me. I created innovative and elegant designs that satisfied the client's needs. I learned a lot from my colleagues.
Interning at a law firm was a great learning opportunity for me. I assisted lawyers with research, drafting, and filing documents. I gained practical and professional skills.
